newsitem.title: ITALY: Fiat sees ex-Italy Euro car sales rising.
newsitem.headline: Fiat sees ex-Italy Euro car sales rising.

text.p: Italian carmaker Fiat Auto saw its November car sales in Europe outside Italy rising 2.5 percent in an overall ex-Italian European car market off some 4.0 percent in the same month.
Industrial sources said that with 47,200 sales in the month Fiat's Punta small car was the best-selling car in Europe.
In the first 11 months of 1996, the ex-Italy European car market rose 7.5 percent while Fiat group sales rose 23.5 percent in the same January-November period.

In this period, Fiat saw sales up 44.8 percent in France in a national market up 11.2 percent, Fiat's sales in Germany were up 28.1 percent in the market up 5.9 percent and Fiat sales in Great Britain were up 24.8 percent in a market up 3.8 percent.

In Italy, the new car November registrations underlined the difficulties of Alfa Romeo with Italian sales off 44 percent, as the Fiat subsidiary awaits its new 145 and 146 models next January with new engines.
